name: Planet Hollywood Resort & Casino

reviews.text: The original Aladdin was completely destroyed a few years ago and replaced from the ground up with this current freak of nature. This is the only Hotel in Vegas that forces you to get lost in the labrynth it calls a shopping mall. Is this a shopping mall/hotel? Or a casino/hotel?
reviews.title: Worst Designed Hotel In Vegas!

reviews.text: First of all, we had to park at the very rear of the hotel and walk all the way through the mall carrying our luggage to get to the front desk to check-in. The only parking they have close to the front desk is valet, but you have to wait forever to get your car when you want to leave.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Aladdin
Old looking, good service
reviews.text: The rooms are a nice size and comfortable, no complaints. Coffee maker would be nice though...Oops I guess Starwood missed that small detail when they took over the hotel.

The pool is on the 6th floor and feels like a public pool at a park. Bad design. Plenty of room for sunbathing though. Despite a big ugly Aladdin looking thing to the west where the sun sets and immediately removes the sun after 3pm. Better go to the pool early, so you can go to the mall and go shopping!
reviews.title: Not so great

reviews.text: No gym access for hotel guests. You have to become a member? Maybe, you should skip working out and just go to the mall and go shopping!
reviews.title: Good Enough, great location , best buffet in Vegas

reviews.text: I purchased a trip to Vegas for my Girlfriend as a Christmas gift and we ended up traveling in late Jan. We stayed 3 nights at the Aladdin, Southwest had some good deals on trips to Vegas out of Denver and the Aladdin was one of the lower priced hotels. I wasn't aware of the construction work before booking and would not have booked had I known. It was a disturbance at times but then it certainly does depend on how much time you spend in the hotel, we didn't spend all our time there so it wasn't too bad but very noticeable at times (7am some mornings).
reviews.title: Good locale, most everything was average

reviews.text: I contacted them in advance and requested a non-smoking King and told I would be fine. We had issues checking in, they gave us a smoking room with 2 small beds, then a non-smoking with a king right next to the elevator shaft and so it went, we wasted a lot of time on our first day with check in.
reviews.title: Great View
Good location. Decent Room. So so service.
reviews.text: The best thing I would say is the location of the hotel, nicely central to the strip.

reviews.title: Started Out Rocky But Ended Well
reviews.text: It is good value while the construction is ongoing.
We had a fountain view room (89.00 promo rate) and it could not be faulted.
reviews.title: Good hotel room - LOTS of construction

reviews.text: I decided to stay at the Planet Hollywood in Vegas because I was seeing a concert in this hotel. I had read some pretty lackluster reviews, but, decided the convenience would be worth it.
reviews.title: Never Again

reviews.text: I had a resort room view, which was fairly large, although most of the "extra" room was in the hallway / foyer area. First...the lighting in this room was horrible. If I needed to read or see anything in detail, I had to go to the bathroom.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, young feel, liked staying there

likes.liked: — location on the strip, place has a vibrant feeling

reviews.text: The bathroom, as previously mentioned, was just...not...that nice. It was clean, but, just looked very old and outdated. I took a bath and the water would not drain.
reviews.title: Fun place.. would go back again!

reviews.text: Housekeeping was sporadic and not very thorough. The 1st day, My room was given four towels and four wash clothes, which I would think would be standard since there were two of us. The 2nd day, we were given two towels and two wash clothes. Both of our soaps were thrown away, but only one was replaced. I had used my glass, and it was replaced on the coaster thing in the bathroom, but had not been cleaned or replaced.
reviews.title: I loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And, this is a small point, but, the room was bland. There was nothing on the walls. We did not have any movie memorabilia in our room, which did not bother me, but it would have bothered me if I was a movie buff and this was the reason I decided to stay here. Taking a bland room and adding purple accents does not necessarily make it "hip" or "fancy".
reviews.title: Nice Place

reviews.text: Location is great, but everything else is not. Here are just some problems:
reviews.title: Great location, but... here are few thing to know

reviews.text: 1. Check-in process is very inefficient, we spent 45 min in line
reviews.title: Great location, looking shabby

reviews.text: 2. You will have to pay extra for everything there (e.g., fitness center, room coffee, extra person, better view, early check-in or check out and etc)
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a good location

reviews.text: 3. Pool closes at 5 pm!!!! And this is in Vegas!
reviews.title: Long wait to check in, long walk to restaurant, show

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 4. Try to call front desk with quick question, they may put you on hold for 10 min!
reviews.title: Amazing resort

reviews.text: Went to the Aladdin Casino for 7 nights in mid Oct 2005 with some really high expectations and overall was quite disappointed.
reviews.title: Not as good as we expected
Great location, great room, fantastic bathroom, great stay
reviews.text: We paid approx $200 per night plus taxes for a room overlooking the Bellagio Fountains but it was really only a partial view. The room was quite small & had not been cleaned that well. We were next to an elevator which was extremely loud. The shampoo/conditioner was in tiny see through plastic containers that looked like they topped up as required. The only special request we had was for 2 extra towels on a daily basis and 6 out of 7 nights we had to phone & remind them. The other thing we noticed (which we also read on another review) was that everytime you touched anything metal you would receive a big electric shock – in particular the elevator buttons.

reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel & Resort
reviews.text: A few days after the trip we noticed an extra charge on our credit card statement for “Room Service” – when we called up to query this they advised it was for 2 bottles of water which we knew nothing about so they refunded it.

reviews.title: Great vacation
reviews.text: The positives about the Aladdin Casino are 1) the actual casino 2) the shopping in the Desert Passage 3) the location which is in the middle of the Strip.
Great location on strip, great room, fantastic bathroom, shower, and tub. Friendly/helpful staff.
reviews.title: Had a fantastic time.
right on the strip...close to everything
reviews.text: We stayed at the Aladdin 3-31 to 4-3-04 and very pleased with our stay at this hotel. Quick check in and a great bell staff that will hold your bags...remember this if you have to check out earlier than your flight time...we spent the extra couple bucks for a view of the fountains at the Belligo...you can even open a vent on the window to hear the music that goes in sync with the fountains...worth the extra $...the bathroom is huge, but the lights were a bit dull...no coffee maker...and yes, like other people have mentioned...take the time to put the do not disturb sign on your door...the one time we didn't I think the housekeeper came in at 8:15 AM...the bus stops right in front of the hotel...worth the 5 bucks for 24hrs...otherwise it's $2.00 each way...good to do on a day your planning to do Fremont street...casino was fun but confusing to navigate...we would recommend this hotel

reviews.title: Aladdin - not that great
reviews.text: A nice clean Casino/Hotel, but the layout was confusing.

reviews.title: Excellent Stay at the Aladdin
reviews.text: On 11/07/03 we arrived there for a 4 day stay - had confirmed a no-smoking room (and didn't get it - not even the next day - and they wouldn't up-grade us).

reviews.title: Aladdin, a piece of Morocco in the states
reviews.text: The food in the restaurants was o.k. - but nothing special (especially for the price). Will never stay there again.

reviews.title: Nice place
reviews.text: We stayed at the Aladdin in one of their Panarama suites. These are awesome, large room with great views of the strip. Big screen television, large roman tub that open up to look onto the strip, wet bar, full marble bathroom, guest bathroom, excellent. Definately the nicest place I've ever stayed with exception of the Four Seasons.

Good: Staff was super nice. We needed extra stuff for our room and they came within 15 mins of our phone call. Having the mall downstairs was excellent and accommodated everyone in our party. Great to have pockets of wifi everywhere (starbucks, restaurants, certain stores in the mall). So much to do within the hotel/casino, restaurants, mall... we don't even have to leave this block! Beds were super duper comfy, excellent sleep. Check-in line looks long when we first arrived, but there were so many staff members to help the line was super fast.
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bad: Free self parking was very far from the hotel, had to lug our luggage through the mall to check in. In room internet is expensive per day charge.
reviews.title: Excellent stay!
Verging on 5 star!
reviews.text: Stayed at the PH from March 29th to April 2. This is the second time staying here. I had stayed here previously in 2009. Had booked the room before the resort fee got added so I was able to escape that fee. Hotel is definitely in an awesome strip location. Everything is right there just footsteps away. 24 hour Walgreens is just outside if you need to get any supplies. Check in was quick. It was about a 10 min wait. Had to pay a $15 early check in fee at 1:30pm which i didn't like but thats Vegas. Room was clean. Had no issues with anything in the room. Note that there is no refrigerator in the room but I'm sure you can request one for a fee. People complain that the casino is loud but I don't find it bad at all. There were lineups for the restaurants but that is to be expected in Vegas on a weekend. Would definitely stay here again. Can't complain when you get $52 a night for one the best locations on the strip.

Your right in the middle, great access just off the I15 and car park is easy to find! It's a HUGH place, defiantly one of the nicest casinos affiliated to a hotel on the strip! We had a superman themed room and the room was MASSIVE! We would defiantly stay here again however maybe not over a weekend as travelling the west coast the room blew our budget..... But it's worth it! Did not have any problems with other hotel guests and we went over spring break, I was abut nervous arriving having read some horror reviews but our stay was amazing! Thumbs up! I personally wouldn't pay the extra for a room facing the strip because more often than not you'll be outside on it anyway! Me and my partner are a little over 21 (uh-hum) however didn't think it was a massively crazy party hotel! They all are! Recommended.....YEP!
reviews.title: Anniversary trip ruined. Don't overpay for subpar quality!

reviews.text: Went with my husband for our wedding anniversary. My mom and dad came along as well and stayed in a separate room. They were there to help watch our baby while we went to do some adult activities. This is why I labelled it family trip instead of couples trip.
reviews.title: Great stay in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from our first trip to Vegas which was made even more enjoyable by a fortunate choice of hotel, Planet Hollywood. Being newly renovated the rooms were smart and well equipped, including a large plazma tv for the early hours. The big plus though, was its location, pretty much central on the Strip, which made getting around so easy.
reviews.title: Hollywood in Vegas

likes.disliked: — lobby area could have been better organised

reviews.text: It ,of course, has a casino which although not as big as some of the others, appeared well laid out making one's gambling preferences that much easier to locate.
reviews.title: Never again....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel also has the Miracle Mile shopping mall attached which besides having the usual stores, had several reasonable eateries to enjoy. For an evening away from the tables go see Steve Wyrick, the magician who has a theatre inside the said mall. Wow!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: We shall certainly return to PH when next visiting the city (a must) but will haggle harder for an upgrade next time.
reviews.title: This hotel is awesome!!!!

reviews.text: Okay, so I'm a Starwood member and I decided to stay at the newly renovated PH, formerly the Aladdin. I have been here every month and the last 3 times I have stayed at the Trump, the Venetian, and the Wynn.
reviews.title: So much fun!
Perfect Strip Location
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from our first trip to

reviews.title: I heeseed at the alladin
reviews.text: Las Vegas from Oct. 3-8. Having read so many negative comments on the computer, I was doubtful

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: if we had made a mistake in booking the Aladdin. I must say we were very pleased with our selection. The location was the best!! We were able to walk the entire strip during our stay. I don't know if I would rate the Aladdin a 4 Star, but must say all in all we were happy. Check in was very fast, but no

reviews.title: Loved the Aladdin
reviews.text: free upgrades are given as stated in many reviews.

reviews.title: Great Stay at the Aladdin
reviews.text: The pros of this hotel: A fabulous buffet(Spice Market)If you register for a Club Aladdin card and use it when gambling you earn comp for food. We were comped every meal and the food was plentiful. The staff was very accomodating. The hotel is very easy to navigate and you will know your way around the first day. The hairdryer in our room was broken and I called the front desk and maintenance was there in minutes to

reviews.title: Great Stay And Nice Hotel & Staff
reviews.text: My husband & I stayed at the Aladin Hotel & Casino in Las Vegas October 10 thru October 14 2005. From check-in to check out the hotel staff was pleasant and the hotel was a great place to stay. The room was impecccable (although the beds a little uncomfortable), and the large tub, separate shower and separate bathroom facilities were a plus. My only hope is that when Planet Hollywood takes over next year that they continue to afford the service and comforts that the Aladin staff did. The machines were pretty loose and we had some success. We would highly recommend this hotel to others and would stay here again. Also the Spa facilities were awesome and quite in line with the price of what you would pay to be pampered at any exclusive spa. Thank you Aladin for an enjoyable visit.

Stayed in the Aladdin for five nights in October. Large, comfortable room and very spacious, well-fitted bathroom. Location is excellent being in the centre of most of the larger hotels on the strip. Ate in the Zanzibar cafe several times and had some good meals there. Generous helpings at reasonable prices. Dessert Passage great for shopping. Large pool area but not much shade - maybe a few more brollies would be nice? Enjoyed our stay at the Aladdin and saw no evidence of any construction work going on in connection with the changeover to Planet Hollywood.
reviews.title: Great Location
Some wins, some losses
reviews.text: We made reservations at Aladdin at the last minute and got a large, clean room at a great price. The bathroom was huge, the room was comfortable and quiet. The brunch buffet at the Spice Market in the casino was underwhelming at $22 a pop. I was horrified to discover they didn't have a waffle station!!! Overall, I would go back again.

reviews.title: Best of the Lot
reviews.text: We stayed at the Aladdin on the nights of October 12 and 13, 2005. We were extremely happy with our room which had a king size bed, was non-smoking, with a desk and chair, as well as an easy chair, table, big armoire and T.V. There was lots of lighting with bed side tables and lamps beside the bed, the carpet was clean and the furniture was not scuffed or marred. The room even smelled good. The bathroom was wonderful with a big soaker tub, a separate shower and loads of counter space - it was huge and very clean with an assortment of toiletries as well as a shower cap, make-up mirror, dryer, everything you could ask for. We were on a three week holiday in the South West U.S. and the Aladdin was the 5th hotel we stayed in and the best of the lot. We wished they could have all been like the Aladdin.
The front desk and bell staff were polite and helpful - no problems or wait at checkin. We would definitely stay at the Aladdin again with no hesitation.
reviews.title: Really Good Value
Nice Stay and Good Location
reviews.text: This was my first trip to the Aladdin as I usually stay at Paris but it was already booked. Average Caisno, the tables were empty for such a busy LV weekend (4/15 to 4/18.) The rooms had very large bathrooms which made the rest of the room feel small, but since I was in it a few hours a day it was not a big deal. My only complains would be the plastic cups (ala Motel 6) in the room and very slow service in the restaurant. The plus is it is very easy for a taxi to get into and out of this hotel given its central strip location.
We're back from our week long trip (4/3-4/10). I had booked the Aladdin after reading the many reviews from this site. I was NOT disappointed!
reviews.title: Worth a Return Trip
Aladdin is Sub-Par
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Vegas and I will definitely stay here the next time. Quick check in service for a Saturday afternoon with immediate upgrade. Good size Resort Room (not the best view but we're here to be outside anyway). Clean rooms and you could do yourself a favor by leaving a little something extra daily for housekeeping. They will go the extra mile for you in all you need! Vaet parking may have long lines, but face it, people, you're on vacation . . . what's your hurry? Desert Passage shops interesting and whole area is well designed. Casino a little hard to manuever, so keep checking blue signs above to figure out where you are. Took us several days to stop walking in circles. Good hotel location to walk to either end of strip. Larger restaurants pricey, so look outside for some good wholesome, reasonable meals (and I don't mean fast-food chains). Best bet for a change of pace would be Red Rocks Canyon - a short 22 mile drive. Breathtaking scenery to unwind from Strip hubbub! We will definitely be back to the Aladdin!

reviews.title: Great Complex!
reviews.text: We arrived at the Aladdin on Easter Sunday, the 11th. Though we are routinely offered complimentary upgrades everywhere else we stay, it did not happen at the Aladdin. The room was nice, and was modern, and very clean. The cleaners knocked on the door very early each morning, which we thought was very rude. The casino is the pits. The blackjack dealers shuffle by hand, and it takes a lot of time. They also offer the sucker trap of 6:5 payout for naturals at their single deck blackjack. The dealers that we encountered seemed rather lackluster, not horrible, but not good either. The drink service to gamblers was extremely slow as well.

reviews.title: Stay here!
reviews.text: There are a lot of better choices on the strip.

This is not my typical hotel. I've stayed at the Wynn, Palazzo, Bellagio, etc. However, I was heading to Vegas for a concert with friends and for them cost was more of an issue. The show itself was at the Planet Hollywood so I figured we'd give it a shot.
reviews.title: Much better than expected for the cost (don't compare it to the Aladdin)

likes.liked: — Nice rooms, bang for the buck, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ended up in an upgraded room for a song. I was thoroughly impressed!
reviews.title: Worst Hotel Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were totally renovated - flat screen TVs, comfortable beds, large bathrooms and bedrooms, working Wifi (even the Wynn hasn't figured this out yet!!). I had zero complaints. Service was quick and attentive.
reviews.title: Vegas First Timers

likes.disliked: — Nothing really that was in the control of the hotel

reviews.text: Hotel location is great.
reviews.title: Rockin' Fun on the Strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint is that the hotel itself is confusing and difficult to navigate.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel room & good buffet @ Spice Market Restaurant

reviews.text: As I explained before, we came to honor our Total Rewards host, Marie Ebner. While in your establishment, we played video poker for a great while and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.
reviews.title: NEAT EXPERIENCE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not have as much time at our disposal as we would have liked, but the next time you can be sure we shall take advantage of more that you have to offer.We did have a great meal at PF Changs...that I can tell you!!!
reviews.title: Good Strip Hotel

reviews.text: I am late getting this review out as I stayed here for my Birthday in August of 2012. I have wanted to stay at this hotel since it first opened and was lucky when I found a good rate through. I love the location on the strip and it is in the middle of things. I just wish they had a tunnel over to their sister Harrah’s hotels of Paris and Bally’s. The check-in is located in what appears to be the basement of the hotel and would only be easily accessible from the underground garage…not from Las Vegas Blvd. The biggest pain of this hotel was Check-in…It was long and painful wait. However, the staff checking us in was friendly and professional. I almost wish they had an automated kiosk to check us in. This would be a big help! I don’t see anything in their check-in process that couldn’t be automated.
reviews.title: average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms – Despite their age, the room still seemed new. The wear on the rooms has been minimal but you certainly do not smell a new building anymore. Probably the biggest indication of this was the carpet in the hallway leading to the room. It was a fashionable pattern but had already started to buckle. If it wasn’t a black carpet in a dimly lit hallway it wouldn’t have been an issue, but having tripped on this, it becomes a safety hazard. Also, it was a long walk from the elevator to the room (but this is expected for Vegas…I have seen worse). The main bedroom had a king bed. It had a nice mattress and nice pillows. I was surprised it was set on a standard metal frame and not a box like in higher end hotels (so as a big guy…watch sitting at the end of the bed). We were upgraded to a class higher room so it had a separate shower and bath combo in a bigger room. It had a larger soaker tub with a large TV screen overhead and separate shower. Even the powder room was separate room between the entry way and bathroom. Being a Planet Hollywood, the rooms were decorated in Hollywood memorabilia. We had Jack Lemmon’s bra in a case from Some Like It Hot which was very odd. There was other memorabilia in a coffee table near the TV in the bedroom. Otherwise the room was smartly decorated. I was surprised that the room had two large screen TVs in the bathroom and main room. Being here over the summer and with the room so far of walk from any place, I just wish the room had a mini fridge (maybe it did, but we couldn’t find it).
reviews.title: Well Placed, Good Facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Resort – I did hit the pool a couple days. Being summer and mid-week, the pool was not too busy. I did even manage to found a lounge by the pool. There are actually two pools…one with loud music and one more relaxing. I enjoyed sitting in the hot tub of the more relaxing pool. I only wish the pool was open later in the hot summer months (but it is Vegas). To get anywhere in the resort or out to LV Blvd…unless you have a car, you must cross the Casino Floor. This experience actually wanted me to gamble less there since you no longer hear the coins dropping into the hopper of winners since they user paper vouchers instead. This was true especially after I put some money into the machines here and nothing came out. We especially liked the Earl of Sandwich, but found it hard to find from the hotel initially. There sandwiches were awesome! I highly recommend it. There was a bar in the back mall that had a good mid-week breakfast special. I think we ate that almost every day we were out there. The mall was nice, but was annoyed by the timeshare sales people every time we wanted to go out to LV Blvd. Also, there is no direct route to LV Blvd or even the Walgreens at the front of this place, so it adds many extra steps to the front of the resort. We did appreciate being able to shop around without having to deal with the hot desert heat, but many of these shops were places we could find back a home. Even Garrett’s popcorn was coming.
reviews.title: Fun Casino with Affordable Gaming
Going to Planet Hollywood
reviews.text: This hotel is easier to navigate then those giant resorts but still has plenty to do within.The shopping mall has many types of stores and resturants this part you can get lost in and not be sure how you return to where you came in at!

We had a 2 bedroom suite which is set up a little strange.You enter through double doors and have a door to the first bedroom which needs a key card and then another set of double doors which also needs-a key card.Keeping all these doors open requires some chairs in front of the doors not a plus.Decor is ok for my money the suites at the Mirage or Venitian are more tasteful and have better quality furniture.If you sat at the end of the bed the top of the bed lifted off the floor!
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: The bath tub between the living room and bedroom with a sliding door that allows you to watch the big screen in the living room-well this is ok except the sliding door doesn't quite close flush and that will let you see in the bathroom after your done in the tub!If you do decide to get in one of their "soaking tubs" be prepared to wait 5-7 minutes for hot water this is standard I called maintnence thinking something was wrong and they told me 5-7 minutes.
reviews.title: Aladdin is Amazing

reviews.text: The room was a wet bar with a refrigerator and no mini-bar.
reviews.title: Wow Wow Wow !!!

reviews.text: Check in and out was simple,.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PH has always been my favorite hotel on the strip b/c of its central location, view of the Bellagio Fountain and Eiffel Tower from Paris on a stripview room and really good deals on its own booking site. We stayed here on memorial day weekend which was surprisingly cool at night but hot during the day. We got a strip view room facing the fountain and Metropolitan Hotel as a free upgrade. The bed was comfy and bathroom is large with a nice tub for the property.
reviews.title: Center of the strip, comfy bed and good bathroom, strip view room fantastic!

reviews.text: Check-in and check-out were easy although I hear lines can be long. Crowd is definitely a younger group compared to other properties, and the restaurants/clubs are not well known. But that's ok.
reviews.title: Better than Expected

reviews.text: We used the pool for one day given it was nice and hot out. Not too crowded and it was nice to have a separate adult only pool. Would definitely come back here or the Wynn/Encore if the price is good there.
reviews.title: planet hollywood

reviews.text: We stayed from Oct 29-Nov 2 and never had any complaints. Yes, some of the carpets were worn but did that affect our stay? Absolutely not. Our room was clean and the service was great. We tipped the maid each day and our room was always made up and cleaned by 1pm.
reviews.title: Starting to get a little chincy

reviews.text: It's located in an excellent location and that's a bonus. I don't think there is much we can complain about except that the slots don't seem to pay out very often and those we stayed with lost a great deal of money :( All of us had more success in old Vegas.
reviews.title: Fun Casino. Terrible Room.
Great price, Great hotel
reviews.text: Stayed at the Aladdin over the weekend of May 7-10th. We had a great stay. We checked in early and they offered us a Bellagio view (partial) and pool view if we wanted to wait a few hours to get our room. We did that, and it was well worth it. Great view! Rooms were great size, bathroom was enormous. Hotel Buffett was very good too, as well as the Cheeseburger in Paradise restaurant. For the price we received on-line, and for a prime weekend, we couldn't ask for a better room. Our room was very quiet and easy to sleep in. The hotel is centrally located and a great starting point for the "walking trips".
The one thing we didn't like was the pool hours. They were open only from 7:00-7:00 I believe. We would have preferred much later hours to enjoy the pool or hottub after the sun went down.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Aladdin Resort and Casino
Would not return
reviews.text: We certainly would recommend the Aladdin if you like a newer hotel at a reasonable price.

reviews.title: Lots of pzazz but a bit confusing
reviews.text: We stayed at the Aladdin hotel Mothers Day weekend. The location was great and our room was huge! Booked thru Alaska Airlines vacations so wasn't sure what type of room to expect. We had a great corner room with 2 large windows and faced the Belligio watershow and Paris Paris - beautiful at night! The pool area was nice but could have used more greenery - lots of concrete. The service at the hotel was above average, very quick checkin. Tried the buffet for breakfast - it was excellent and more food choices than anyone needs. Just be sure to bring your walking shoes - even though we were in the middle of the strip just getting across the street means crossing 6 lanes of traffic! The Celine Dion show was amazing - I would highly recommend it - got half price tickets just before showtime right at the theaters box office!

reviews.title: Had a fabulous stay!
reviews.text: stayed here in april 2003 would not return. good things - quick check in, 2 starbucks locations- (they were very busy so there was a wait) and the buffet has excellent food. would return there to eat. bad things- the room service was not coming around to even switch out towels, i checked in with a wedding party and we requested to be put close together then apon arrival, we were seperated as well on diffrent floors. the cafe was horrid. the food is plain and expensive. for being the newest hotel opened there pool is square and about 5 feet deep.and to tan good luck-the hotel is blocking the sun all you get is shade and you get to walk a distance to get to the pool.

I was originally booked at another location and was forced into the Planet Hollywood. Even though the rooms were smaller and maybe not as nice, everything was good. Everything was clean and everything was nice in the Planet Hollywood. I would suggest this hotel to anyone who like a nice, clean and cost effect place to stay.
reviews.title: My second option became a great stay

reviews.text: When in Vegas, the place to stay is "Planet Hollywood Resort and Casino". It is centrally located near the Miracle Mile Mall. There are some wonderful attractions and restaurants including Gordon Ramsey's "BURGR" which is great. You will have a memorable experience at the casino.
reviews.title: The Place to Stay!

reviews.text: My husband and I were celebrating our 1 year anniversary in Vegas. We stayed at the Aria which was super boring so we walked over to Planet Hollywood for lunch. We ate at Burgr which was amazing then checked out the casino. We fell in love with the staff and went back every day for our week long vacation. Everyone was friendly yet professional. Our roulette dealers were the best!!! Dawn, Kimmy, Vessey, Amy, Heidi, and John really made it a great experience. I cant forget about Ken, Christina, and Joe who went above and beyond to keep us happy.
reviews.title: Planet Hollywood... where everyone is treated like a star!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rosa is the best cocktail server so make sure you find her area. She never lets your drink get too low and she keeps a smile on her face. My husband had to return back to Afghanistan but will go back to Planet Hollywood for sure.
reviews.title: Great property! Awesome staff! Easy check-in!

reviews.text: Flew to Vegas for one night to see New Order and Johnny Marr across the street at the Cosmopolitan...stayed at the Planet Hollywood since it was very convenient...check in was flawless and the hotel rep gave us a room with an awesome Strip view without even asking us! Same low rate but great view!! Had a king size bed, great flat screen tv, free wi-fi and the bathroom was huge with walk in shower and big tub!!! A very clean room!
reviews.title: It is ok

reviews.text: I just came back from staying at Planet Hollywood Casino & Resort - we stayed from 11/28 to 11/30. We got a deal that was $200 for 2 nights, although there were some taxes and fees that pushed it over that in the end. Overall I thought the place was pretty nice. We had a standard room but it had a nice view of the city and the room was spacious, with a really comfortable bed and decent furniture. The bathroom was fabulous and the shower pressure was the BEST part! The a/c was strong and not smoky. The maid service was great. The colors are dark, yes, but I didn't mind that. There were a few things they could have done better in the remodel, but hey, everything is not going to be perfect for $100/night. It would be nice if they give you free wifi though, and have a little refrigerator in the room. The hotel itself is large and cool - it is a part of a mall so you can easily walk around and shop and eat and then go play in the casino. The casino itself was smoky, but every casino in LV is smoky. And there is easy access to the strip outside if you want to go somewhere else. I would recommend this hotel for the money. I'm a picky traveler, and I was very satisfied here and would certainly come back. If you stay here I would avoid the expensive buffet and eat breakfast and other meals at the Cheeseburger restaurant in the mall - good food and good prices!
reviews.title: Pretty Good, Enjoyable Stay at PH

likes.disliked: — You have to pay for wifi

reviews.text: Stayed at Planet Hollywood for the Hatton fight,absolutely amazing is all I can say,the rooms were nice and clean and modern,all the staff nice and helpfull, huge building site across the road but you cant hear any of it.The casino floor was buzzing non stop,the heart bar in the middle of the casino is nice and relaxed, not that we were,the staff were all top and up for a giggle.Could do with the working girls being a bit more discreet, was ok with the lads but would'nt like to be there with the wife.That aside what a top place to stay,some of the other fellas in our party stayed at the Bellagio but loved PH more.
reviews.title: 24h party

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we just returned from 5 days in p h it was absolutely amazing. we had a fountain view room and to see the fountain go off at night from the room was amazing. everything about the hotel was great.would defo recomend this hotel. some people said this hotel was very noisy with the music we had no problems with this, you could still talk to each other without shouting. the casino was great too. hopefully if flights are still cheap next year we will be back.
reviews.title: disneyland for adults

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from a long weekend stay at Planet Hollywood. We were there from 11/20-11/23 celebrating my wife's birthday. We have both traveled to Las Vegas many times before and decided to try out this relatively new property. It is safe to say we will be back! We loved everything about the place. The rooms are hip, the casino has great energy, the staff was friendly, and the location is fantastic. I strongly recommend you give this place a shot if you are traveling to Las Vegas any time soon!!!
reviews.title: New Favorite

likes.liked: — It feels like LA inside. The energy is amazing!
likes.disliked: — TV Channels sucked and were hard to navigate (but seriously, in Vegas who cares)?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Never again!!! First of all the room was not all that. Not to mention, if more than one person sits at the foot of the bed, the mattress will indeed lift at the top, and possibly dump you off. The lighting in the room was poor. The Planet Dailies restaurant customer service was absurd. The waiter bought back the wrong orders, not once, but three times, and blamed his incompetence on a hearing problem. When the manager was addressed, regarding this issue, instead of help the situation, he made it worst by making more excuses.
reviews.title: Worst Customer Service Ever

reviews.text: I have just returned from Lost Wages, I take a group over every year (PAX 40 +) we were in town for business (Sema Show) and pleasure. The location on the strip is perfect, everything you need in walking distance.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: My room over looked the swimming pools and the strip through a small window the rooms are a little dark could do with some More lighting,
reviews.title: Don't let reviews worry you, it's a good place to stay .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At night I found the walls a little thin and excessive street noise, the room was OK and bed was very comfortable.
reviews.title: What happens in Vegas......sometimes gets tripadvisor'd

reviews.text: The food at the breakfast spice buffet was very average and would recommend going elsewhere, the food in the mile high mall was excellent.
reviews.title: Dont read..... Just book. :-)

reviews.text: The staff service was adequate and check in was slow as my room was not ready till 5pm. Probably will not return to this resort.
reviews.title: 3 dressed up as a 9
Simply the best!!!!!!
reviews.text: just returned from a fanstatic time in las vegas. i took my mother as a 80th birthday present. before you start laughing, my mother maybe 80, but she looks 60, and gets around like she's 20. we stayed at the aladdin oct 25 - oct 28. when we arrived at the hotel at 8:45a.m. i never thought we would be able to check in, since check-in was at 3p.m. but the young lady at the check-in counter was very pleasant and informed us our deluxe room wouldn't be ready for a couple of hours. at that time i decided to try the $20 trick, and asked her how true it was, she just smiled. then while she was still checking the computer, i asked about any free upgrades, she said she could put us in a fountain view at no additional cost, and that the room was ready now, so i jumped at that offer. so the $20 trick worked for us, i guess. the room was great, huge, clean, and the bathroom enormous. we had a perfect view of the bellagio fountains. lighting was a little dim, but not as bad as some have complained. also the rma's were at the aladdin the 25th, i saw usher, sly stalone, ashley simpson, tim mcgraw, brian mcknight, hulk hogan, and others, also got some pictures. didn't eat much at the hotel, so can't comment on that. the room was clean and when we travel, we don't use housekeeping, we just ask for clean towels, toiletries, and plastic trash bags everyday, and set dirty items outside the door, we just left the privacy sign in place because we prefer not to have people in our rooms, especially when we're not there. plus we don't change sheets everyday at home. but housekeeping did call our room everyday and left a message that the room wasn't cleaned because of the privacy sign, but if we needed housekeeping to call them. we did use the in-room safe deposit box, very convenient. also the aladdin has a very good 'club' where guests can earn points to obtain free items if you have enough points. both of us were able to receive, a cap, a polo shirt, a blue jean jacket, a mug, a free meal, and cash, $12 for me, and $11 for my mother. the slots weren't as tight as some other casinos, i came back with more than i went with. we walked around the desert passage mall twice, nice shops, expensive, but nice, but we don't go to vegas to spend alot of time shopping, we can do that at home. before i went i thought it might be another 5yrs before i'd go again, but next year is looking promising. last thing, the only complaint i have was the weather, cool and rainy, but that didn't stop us. we went to laughlin nv, and sams town. i know i've typed enough, but it was an awesome vacation, and my mother had just the best time. we both did!!

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: Stayed from Monday 27 Sept - Friday 1st Oct. You cannot get any better than this hotel for location. Its slap bang in the middle of the strip and opposite the Bellagio. At check-in I had a reservation for the monday and tuesday night, and a seperate one for the last 2 nights. Although I had emailed a month in advance and been told not to worry, I was told at check-in I may well have to change rooms halfway thru. Couldnt be bothered to try and 20 buck trick if that was the case. Room was a very good size, clean, overlooked the valet car park thing tho, but mountains in the distance. Like any of the bigger hotels on the strip, it takes forever to try and find our way out onto the street. Only ate at PFChangs and that was nice. Great for the strip, were very busy seeing everyhting so didnt go to the pool much, but compared to say the Mandalay Bay. It was 2 small oblong pools and 2 hot tubs and very concretey. Nice though, great location, it really was perfect. Glad we stayed there compared to the Venetian because I think my feet would have totally dropped off if we would have walked from there everyday.

reviews.title: Lovin' The Alladin
reviews.text: My husband and I went to LV on our honeymoon at the beginning of October. We stayed 5 nights at the Alladin and were very impressed with the hotel. They upgraded us to a Resort Vista with a huge bathroom with a TV in it, I could watch TV every morning as I took a bath and watch the Bellagio fountains every evening. We were planning on staying in a deluxe/regular room but they offered the upgrade for FREE because it was out honeymoon. The location was great because it is center strip. The service was excellent. We are breakfast every morning at a coffee shop in the Desert Passage. The first night we caught a quick bite at the Zanzibar Cafe (which was great) before we discovered the Desert Passage eateries. Fat Tuesday's is my big FAV, cause it's drinks to go. I wish I has tried Cheeseburger in Paradise instead of Blondies in the Passage. We had the Spice Market Buffet, but it was a waste for us because we don't eat that much at one time. I loved Alladin Hotel and they made our honeymoon great and I want to try somewhere else next time but am afraid to because I have been spoiled by the Alladin. We spent our last night at Caesar's and was not comfortable there, the people are ritzy and the room was small, even for a jacuzzi room. I wished I had kept our room at the Alladin. The other tourists there was normal everyday people.

reviews.title: its Magical
reviews.text: My husband and I just came back from a 3 night stay in Las Vegas at the Aladdin resort hotel.(October 17-20)

reviews.title: 1st time in Vegas in 25 years
reviews.text: Having been to Las Vegas three times prior, we always try to stay at a different hotel each time we travel to Las Vegas. We have previously stayed at the Luxor(great hotel but too far down the strip),MGM Grand(too much navigation to get out of the casino or to your room) and the Treasure Island (too boring and plain). I did a lot of research trying to decide whether or not to stay on the strip again or try out downtown. We decided to stay midway on the strip…so we came across the Aladdin.

My friend and I came back to our room to find our laptop computers stolen from inside our bags. The hotel staff DID NOTHING. They basically blamed us for not putting them in a safe. We know their maids did it because they have plenty of places to hide computers in their carts. The staff was not sympathetic, did not do anything for us. I refuse to stay there or ever give them one penny. Please do not give them one yourself.
reviews.title: Aladdin Steals!
Great Stay, Great Location
reviews.text: Stayed 11th April to 18th April. Check-in was quick and easy - no queues and was easy to find the desk. Got a fountain view room which was very nice at night - overlooked the Bellagio fountains, the Paris eiffel tower and Paris arc de triomphe (sorry about the spelling!). The room was a little worn but was big as was the bathroom, the housekeeping was great and they left extra towels every day for a couple of bucks - they did a really good job tidying up after me!. Also got some vouchers at check in for free spa use and money off in the restaurants. Spice Market buffet was ok but not great, Zanzibar cafe was a bit more expensive than I would have liked but was really nice food. The construction work did not get in the way for me. The casino is about half the size it could be but is still quite massive anyway. There was no mess/dust and only a little noise in the middle of the night (you couldnt hear it from the room, only in the casino). Everything else is business as usual. The dealers/croupiers were all really fun and helpful as they were everywhere I went (also had great nights in New York and Downtown). They are working on the front of the hotel but there is no disturbance to the entrances - it is still easy to enter and exit to the strip. The location is perfect by the way - you are in the middle of the action, Paris is 2 mins next door, Caesars is 5 mins walk away and Bellagio is across the road, New York is 10 min walk, TI and Mirage about 15 mins and the Fashion Show Mall is probably 20 mins walk. Having the Desert Passage shops was a real bonus as well - giving you extra choice for food (Blondies was good) and letting you buy snacks and drinks from ABC at cheap prices. It is also worth signing up for the casino club card - they gave me $10 slot play for signing up and when it came to check-out I had earned enough points for a t-shirt and coffee mug (which was nice for free!). It also allows you to have a free spin every day on the Aladdin slot machine (I won some tickets to X-Girls, which was a little disappointing by the way).

I have no regrets about stopping at the Aladdin, if fact I would have no problems stopping there again (I have stopped at TheHotel at Mandalay which was obviously 10 times better but also twice the price). I am hoping that they will send me some deals for next year - I would take them.
reviews.title: Aladdin - what a deal!!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Aladdin in mid April. I had a special promo code to get a room for $59. (Sun-Thurs Only)
reviews.title: If you get a good deal...

reviews.text: What a GREAT place! Despite being under some construction...it was not a problem. All construction areas were blocked off, and were hardly noticeable. I checked in early 11:00am, a room was ready. When I went in...it was NOT ready, beds sheets were removed, etc. I went back downstairs, and I received a better room with a great view of Paris! and the Bellagio Fountains. The room was great! Large! The bathroom was amazing....HUGE seperate soaker tub, plus a stand alone shower, and a huge vanity. The bathroom was bigger than some hotel rooms I've seen. LOL
reviews.title: Never Stay Here!!!!!!!!!!!
ohhhh My Lorddddd!!!!!!
reviews.text: Wow, I loved this place...the beautiful towering pillars, the casino, the rooms, the service, the food-the mall- everything was great... awesome shops and fun little antiqe-like boutiques -just awesome-great for kids and for adults..so cool- night sky made in the mall...turns dark at night, hotel is clean, and has multiple floors and game rooms...shuttle service, great concierge and excellent room service... i must've called room service like 25 times in 5 days for amenties that i passed out to all my friends in chicago when i got back (always tipped well). Fun surrounding hotels...Paris, Bellagio, Venetian down the way- bring your walking shoes! I'll be there again in 12/2004! I love this place. Don't forget- must have breakfast at Caesar's Palace across the sreet-out of this world amazing- just cross over the strip- it's right there.

reviews.title: I like it here
reviews.text: I liked this hotel. The staff was friendly as were the waitresses in the casino. The room above us was leaking down into ours so they gave us another room which faced the fountains at the Bellagio on the top floor and also gave us $50 to eat at any restraunt in the hotel, so I cant complain. I also won $2500 in the casino, so I really cant complain. All in all it was a comfortable stay and I really enjoyed myself there. I would stay at the Aladdin again.

reviews.title: LOVED LOVED LOVED THE ALADDIN
reviews.text: I am a VERY picky person. Me & my husband LOVED LOVED LOVED the Aladdin. We tipped $20 and were put right across from the Belagio fountains..... bathrooms are HUGE with a LARGE tub which is wonderful after a long day walking the strip...... I would highly recommend staying here ......... I don't think you will be disappointed. Pool is gorgeous..... drinks great (play video poker & they are ALL free :o) We always stay at the Ritz and were VERY pleased here :o) Enjoy your trip :o)

reviews.title: Loved the Aladdin!!!
reviews.text: Believe me when i tell you i would be the 1st one to complain and the ONLY thing i can complain about is the bus system which has nothing to do with the Aladdin. My stay at the Aladdin from Oct.3-8 was FABULOUS!! I actually wish we stayed a few more days just to enjoy the room itself. I tried the "$20 trick" and yes it worked. We were upgraded to a resort vista room with a view of the Bellagio fountains, Paris hotel, the pool, etc. AWESOME!!! The room was big with his and her closets, the bathroom was huge (including the tub with a window to look out from). I have read a lot of complaints on here about people that work in the hotel being nasty and all i can say about that is you get what you give!! We were nice and respectful and were treated in the SAME way in return. Everyone was VERY nice and went out of their way to help us. I have stayed in Aruba, Cancun, Florida, cruises, Bahamas, and have done a lot of traveling and stayed in the best of places and i definitely recommend staying here regardless of people's complaints. As i said before i am VERY picky and can only say nice things of the hotel and its staff. ENJOY your stay at Aladdin as i know i did!!! :)

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text: Just returned from a 4-night stay at the Aladdin. Beautiful room and extra-large bath. Location across from Bellagio and next door to Paris was perfect. Highly recommend this hotel!

reviews.title: Really bad service!
reviews.text: I made reservations for this hotel on the internet for a one night stay on November 4th, and they really messed up. We arrived around two o'clock and the reservation desk was a mess. They overbooked the hotel and they claimed that they did not receive a reservation from us and they did not have room for us. They were a lot of other people who couldn't get a room either in the Aladdin that night. It was a shame. I came all the way from The Netherlands to Las Vegas and we were really looking forward to our stay, but this was a big dissapointment. All the other nice hotels in Las Vegas were also fully booked for that night so there wasn't any room for us in Las Vegas. I think they gave our room to people who offered to pay more than we did on the internet. And they claimed in on the internet travelsite. But I use this site all the time and it never went wrong except this one time!

reviews.title: I like this
reviews.text: As from the reopening in 2000 there is much to do about this resort. Many people seem to dislike it and I really do not understand why. I stayed here from 1 to 4 November 2004 in a Deluxe with premium strip view. This is the smallest room in the house, but with a very good view, that I am fond of. I have stayed in the Aladdin a few times earlier. The room was furbished nicely, spacious enough, even to LV standards, and certainly clean. Bathroom is great, with a separate shower. Front desk people are snotty, but professionnal. Casino is very nice (although I am not a gambler, so my opinion is worth nothing in this respect). Spice market buffet is great. Is seems to have undergone a certain upgrading and reorientation compared to a year or two ago and now definitely is better than the Bellagio and Paris buffets (I also went there). Of course, the position of the Aladdin on the strip is excellent. I really recommend the Aladdin, especially to those who do not only come for gambling and/or conventions and appreciate a good LV hotel for a non Venetian price. There are a few down sides. There is no serious ´comping´ and upgrading going on in this hotel, that I do not care about, but that might explain reviews of less satisfied travellers. Furthermore this hotel seems to increase it´s prices regularly and this might well become their definitive death, because it is not and never will be on the same level as the Bellagio or Venetian. Also the speed of the (non complementary) internet terminal in the room is not so high speed according to current standards.

I stayed four nights at the Aladdin during my first trip to Las Vegas. Of all the resorts on the strip, the Aladdin has the best casino. It is beautiful and the variety of games is excellent. Our room had a full view of the Eiffel Tower at Paris and a partial view of the fountains at the Bellagio. The room had a huge bathroom with a shower and a tub. The buffet was wonderful too. The best aspect of the Aladdin is the location. It's mid-strip location is perfect for walking to the other casinos. For those who like to shop, the Desert Passage Mall inside the hotel is nice. In one area, on the hour, you hear thunder and it starts raining. Tres cool. Since this was my first visit to Vegas, I'm not sure, but due to the desert climate, there may be laws regarding water restrictions. My only beef with the Aladdin was the loud noise the toliet made. Again, it may be because of the local regulations to have pressurized small-tank toliets, but the result is that you can hear the neighbors' toliet through the walls. This may sound petty, but bolting out of bed to the sound of rushing water at 3 AM is not my idea of a good time. All that being said, I'd stay at this hotel again. Next time, I'm bringing ear plugs and something to keep my sinuses moist. The dry Nevada air didn't agree with me.
reviews.title: Loved the Aladdin!

reviews.text: Just returned to the UK from my 5th trip to Las Vegas , 2nd stay at the Aladdin.
reviews.title: Love it more and more..
Loved it
reviews.text: It was convention week in Vegas and despite booking the hotel 3 months ago, we paid more than 3 times the usual rate. As there were 6 of us, I booked 3 resort rooms which upon checking in at 4pm, were all ready and waiting. The hotel was compleatly full for the 5 nights of our stay, but seemed to cope amazingly. We only queued once for the buffet which was awesome. Plenty of tables open at all hours of the day to play on and of course the complete range of slots etc. We had amazing rooms overlooking the strip and the great fountains of the Bellagio. I cannot fault this hotel what so ever and hope that when it changes to Planet Hollywood sometime soon, it remains among my favorite along the strip.

reviews.title: WOW GREAT CASINO AND RESORT
reviews.text: I go to Vegas between 3 and 6 times a year for gambling, leisure, and fun. My girlfriend and I usually stay at the Aladdin. We are college students, just graduating this May (2004) and the Aladdin has allowed us to maximize our gaming and entertainment budget by offering us high quality rooms at bargain prices. The buffet, while it is not on the same level as Paris and Bellagio, it is the next best buffet in Vegas. Most of the slots are loose for strip casinos. The bar tenders and sportsbook staff are friendly, and it is easy to build friendships with them if you even just visit once a year. The rooms are great, the bathrooms are huge. Our last trip we were given a free upgrade to a suite, and i highly recomend staying in the suites if you can budget it. For table games, go elsewhere. Monte Carlo and Paris have great roulette tables, and friendly staff. Casino Royale has great craps paybacks!

reviews.title: A Good Vacation
reviews.text: Overall, the Aladdin is by far the best deal for the money. Its a four star resort, for a 3 star price! Beat that!

reviews.title: Aladdin is OK at best
reviews.text: We came with two other couples and stayed April 25-29. We chose the Aladdin because of its central location and overall ratings. We were not disappointed. We had a most enjoyable stay. The Desert Passage is one of the best malls of any hotel on the strip. We found the staff to be courteous and friendly. The Aladdin is a quality hotel with excellent atmosphere. No hotel is perfect but the Aladdin is one of the best values on the strip.

reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay- Great location.
reviews.text: I spend about 90 nights a year in the hotel rooms. With all the options in Las Vegas I think you can do better price and room wise. Had a resort room overlooking the Bellagio 4-26 to 4-30. Positives: Room is large, strip location is good for easy acess to points east or west, casino is good, the upper level bar is quite nice and with very good bands. Negatives: Carpeting was stained with blood and had to transfer to another room. ....no one ever apologized or offered assistance with bag transfer. The odor of cooking food from the lower kitchens wafted up into the room....OK to smell bacon at 7 a.m.....was kind of disgusting to smell greasy fish odor at midnight. I think the Luxor (Tower Rooms, not the Pyramid) are a better value and you can get offers there for free spa passes with your stay. I was also a little surprised that as an Alladin hotel guest no small incentives (ie. 10% off at the buffet) were offered. Won't be back.

reviews.title: Great Hotel on the Strip
reviews.text: Spent 3 days at the Alladin, 4-28 to 5-1 and had a very enjoyable trip. We have stayed at the Mirage and the Rio, and the Alladin seemed nicer to me. Checked in at 3:00 pm and had no wait. Everyone was friendly and efficient at the check in window. No upgrade, we were offered a fountain view for $30/night extra. Our room was nice, especially the bathroom, lots of space. I chose the Alladin primarily because of its location, and wasnt disappointed. Everything we did was within easy walking distance in both directions.

Stayed in Planet Hollywood casino on the strip for 4 nights. It’s a great central location. Rooms weren’t bad, very clean and comfortable but everything is very dark. The casino was the smokiest of all I was in and probably tackiest too. Spent a day by the pool which is just an L-shape box. They’re going for a minimalist “Skyy vodka” cabana theme. Music blared away but I guess it drowned out the traffic and airplanes. Many other hotels have water features to do this. Overall I’d say going for the young weekend smoking crowd. This was our 3rd time in vegas and wanted to try somewhere new. I’ve stayed in Excalibur and Monte Carlo before and would definitely go back to Monte Carlo and would not be back here. I visited my friends room in the Encore, would DEFINITELY recommend it, but location isn’t great for a Vegas sight seer (and price is a bit much too!!)
reviews.title: Suited the trip, but won't be back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our two night stay in late October was a very pleasant experience.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly helpful personnel, a most comfortable, clean & quiet room on the 29th floor.
reviews.title: Needs a face lift

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area, not that we wanted to swim or chill out there wasn't overly invited & could do
reviews.title: Planet Hollywood Las Vegas

reviews.text: with a bit of ambiance! (how about some more trees, some shrubs & some lawn. Bit too much concrete right now!)
reviews.title: Love PH!!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Aladdin Oct. 26-28 for my son's wedding. I thought the hotel was beautiful. The room was very comfortable, bathroom out of this world, food was good everywhere we went and the staff very friendly and helpful. We did very well in the casino and I had a good time there. All in all, it was the best trip we've ever had to Vegas and I plan to stay there again next year and check out Planet Hollywood.
reviews.title: "Perfect stay"

reviews.text: we stayed for 2 days at the Aladdin in October 2005, and really enjoyed the experience. The hotel is not as "over the top" as some of the hotels in Vegas, we enjoyed the same view looking over the fountain as the people staying at the far more expensive Bellagio, big bonus. The hotel is spotlessly clean, and the staff very helpful. The buffet is amazing with a great choice and averagely priced. We had to queue but this moved quickly and was worth the wait. The bedroom was quite big, with a lovely sized bathroom with seperate toilet, the bath is really big. The only down side being no hairdryer, but perhaps we should have requested one. We saw hardly any signs of Planet Hollywood taking over, but we feel the hotel will not suffer for this takeover.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay,

reviews.text: I stayed here a couple weeks ago for three nights. The rate was awesome! $59 on a weekday, and $169 on the weekend when ever other place was charging over $209. I've been wanting to try this place out for a while now, as it has a great location, and it's prices always seem to be too good to be true for it's location. I guess I'll start off with the good... great rate, great location, great view of Bellagio fountains if you get a view room. Now for the bad... the sheets are like sandpaper. Seriously, I left with what looked to be rug burns in various places of my body. I didn't believe the other posts on this issue, but having experienced it for myself, I can say it's true. Another annoying thing is that they don't use humdifiers in the place. Most hotels on the strip, you won't even notice this touch, but it became apparent after staying one night here. Your skin will become extremely dry and itchy, and everything metalic you touch will shock you. The bath products suck too, and a couple of the bottles we were given were empty. The bathroom was quite large (with a separate tub and shower), but the overall quality of the room/hotel seemed more budget than anything else. This place is in need of a complete remodeling, and it'll be interesting to see what happens when it becomes Planet Hollywood in 2006.
reviews.title: many things to dislike
My Stay @ Aladdin
reviews.text: As always, had a great stay at Aladdin. Great location, great staff, good food and Desert Passage has 140+ shops--no real need to leave there, but of course it's impossible to stay in one place when in Vegas (but it's good to know you have that great option @ Aladdin. Asked and received room w/a view-directly facing Bellagio (dancing water)and Paris. First room's view wasn't bad, but had seen that view when I stayed there previously. Hotel will become Planet Hollywood next year--its slowly evolving now. Will give PH a try next year because after all, it all comes down to location, location and location!
Just returned from a 5 night comped stay oct24-29. This place rocks!
reviews.title: Aladdin Rules!

reviews.text: Loved our stay at the Planet Hollywood Casino! It attracts a younger crowd & the place is always hopping! The open layout & extremely high ceilings makes it much less smokey than the older places. The hotel room was clean & big. The bed was really comfortable. We got a free upgrade to a suite & we didn't even have to ask for it! We were on the 9th floor & could not hear any noise from the casino or the strip. The hotel is right in the middle of the strip so it's within walking distance of just about everything. When I go back, I will stay there again with out a doubt!
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a nice place to stay in Vegas. It is very well located and the rooms are clean, spacious and well decorated. The amenities are also very much in line with what you find in Vegas' best hotels: casino, shopping mall, lots of restaurants nearby and freezing air conditioning...
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed for 5 nights in july 2012 - staff on front desk friendly & efficient - acceded to our request for a room as high up as possible - other staff very helpful & friendly - rooms however were rather "tired-looking" - furniture very dated - gouges /scratches evident -also furniture very dark -always needed curtains open in daytime -have issues with their pools & policies thereof - 1 pool completely closed off to guests unless you rented a cabana fo $280/day or a bed for $65/day- were told we had to leave this pool when someone rented a bed or cabana - other pool had some cabanas/beds & you had to get to the pool by 8:30 in the morning to get a deck chair -we ended sitting in a common area & going back & forth to the pool - rather disconcerting - victimized by blatant money grab -everything else about the hotel was good - no complaints
reviews.title: friendly staff but some annoying deficiencies

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I had a great time at the Planet Hollywood! The hotel is modern, the design is original, it is clean and very quiet on the room floors, the pools are nice with a DJ starting at the end of the afternoon and the location? Can't ask for a better spot!!! You're in the middle of the greatest strip attractions and you find everything you need in the same building: shops, Starbuck Coffee, great places to eat, a great selection of entertaining shows, nightclubs,...
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: We just loved it!!
reviews.title: didnt like it

reviews.text: Stayed at Aladdin from 5/5 to 5/9. Arrived via taxi about 2:30 on the Friday of busy weekend. Had no problem finding the new registration area as there are numerous signs pointing the way. No line at check in so it only took about 5 minutes. Clerk was very polite.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: I had a basic room (I think they call it deluxe). The room was a decent size and the bathroom was very large. The room was clean upon arrival and maid service was good throughout the stay. My one gripe with this room was that the window was fairly small and it was located in the corner of the room. It keeps the room a little dark and makes it tough to appreciate any view. They also opted to place the table in front of it. This is one design flaw that Planet Hollywood will not be able to fix.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: On our third day my friend realized that the Aladdin was now a Starwood hotel. Since he has platinum status he got us upgraded to a Resort room. This room was much larger although some of the additional space is wasted in the entry area. Other additions include a couch and a 2nd sink area in the bathroom. It was also much brighter since it had 2 windows.
reviews.title: Don't Bother

reviews.text: We did not find the construction to be at all intrusive. In fact we only saw two construction workers the entire stay. There are some temporary walls here and there but they didn't interfere with anything.
reviews.title: Great, in spite of construction!

reviews.text: The pool area is pretty plain by Vegas standards but it was fine. There are two pools separated by a big open area one staff person called a sun deck. The pools are raised higher then the deck area which I would say is a poor design because you can only actually be poolside from a limited number of seats. On the plus side, it was easy to find chairs even on saturday and the drink service was good.
reviews.title: Excellent anniversary stay at the Aladdin!

description: Experience celebrity first hand at the "House that Fame Built" - Planet Hollywood Resort & Casino. With star-worthy accommodations and an upscale atmosphere, you never know who you might see. After all, the resort is known for hosting some of the biggest film stars as they debut their newest films. Here everybody's PHamous! Dine like a star at Koi, the Hollywood hotspot where Japanese tradition meets California innovation or Strip House, the critically acclaimed NYC-based steakhouse. On the casino floor, Heart Bar, The Playing Field and The Pleasure Pit ensure non-stop excitement each with their own brand of fun. Upstairs on The Mezz, Gallery Nightclub and the PCD Burlesque Saloon are a star-studded one-two punch of glamorous nightlife, while Holly Madison takes sexy center stage in the striptease spectacle PEEPSHOW. You can also discover the latest trends at the Miracle Mile Shops or socialize and sunbathe at the Pleasure Pool. For those who’d rather relax indoors, the Spa by Mandara hosts a bevy of rejuvenating services in a calm, serene setting.
